title: -128i8 / -1 emits "attempted to divide with overflow" error multiple times

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
``` rust
fn main() {
    let x = -128i8 / -1;
    println!("{}", x);
}
```

```
<anon>:2:13: 2:24 warning: attempted to divide with overflow, #[warn(const_err)] on by default
<anon>:2     let x = -128i8 / -1;
                     ^~~~~~~~~~~
<anon>:2:13: 2:24 warning: attempted to divide with overflow
<anon>:2     let x = -128i8 / -1;
                     ^~~~~~~~~~~
```

It's worse if the division is inline in the macro:

``` rust
<anon>:2:20: 2:31 warning: attempted to divide with overflow, #[warn(const_err)] on by default
<anon>:2     println!("{}", -128i8 / -1);
                            ^~~~~~~~~~~
<std macros>:2:25: 2:56 note: in this expansion of format_args!
<std macros>:3:1: 3:54 note: in this expansion of print! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:5: 2:33 note: in this expansion of println! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:20: 2:31 warning: attempted to divide with overflow
<anon>:2     println!("{}", -128i8 / -1);
                            ^~~~~~~~~~~
<std macros>:2:25: 2:56 note: in this expansion of format_args!
<std macros>:3:1: 3:54 note: in this expansion of print! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:5: 2:33 note: in this expansion of println! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:20: 2:31 warning: attempted to divide with overflow
<anon>:2     println!("{}", -128i8 / -1);
                            ^~~~~~~~~~~
<std macros>:2:25: 2:56 note: in this expansion of format_args!
<std macros>:3:1: 3:54 note: in this expansion of print! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:5: 2:33 note: in this expansion of println! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:20: 2:31 warning: attempted to divide with overflow
<anon>:2     println!("{}", -128i8 / -1);
                            ^~~~~~~~~~~
<std macros>:2:25: 2:56 note: in this expansion of format_args!
<std macros>:3:1: 3:54 note: in this expansion of print! (defined in <std macros>)
<anon>:2:5: 2:33 note: in this expansion of println! (defined in <std macros>)
```

This happens with `%` too. But standalone `let x = -128i8 - 1` only emits "attempted to sub with overflow" once, and it is only emitted 3 times when inside the macro (similarly for `+` and `*`).
